metaData.title: Rosia Montana | accommodation | hikes | bike | trails
metaData.description: Accommodation in a restored heritage house from the Historic Center. Hiking or bike trails along the roman galleries, gold mining areas, heritage buildings, mountains, lakes. Rent bikes or guided tours. At the end of the day read a book from our library in the hammock. Rosia Montana, Alba, Apuseni Mountains, Transylvania, Romania.

specificArticles.textContent: The remains of the gold mining that started since antiquity (galleries, stamp mills, artificial lakes) and the historic center with the heritage buildings made by the civilizations who came here to extract gold (schools in different languages, multicultural churches or the goldsmith houses) can be visited by the following trails:

sections.text: Enjoy the natural beauty of our area

specificArticles.textContent: The surroundings are also amazing. Unpaved roads and footpaths bind us to villages, mountain peaks, lakes and other objectives of the Apuseni Mountains (Carpathians - Transylvania). The bellow trails are great hiking or cycling escapes (you can rent bikes from Rosia).

sections.text: See the impact of open pit mining

specificArticles.textContent: The cooper pit 'Roșia Poieni' and his waste lake can be seen along the 'Geamana' trail. Visit the gold mining open pit along the 'Cârnic' trail. The area were a new gold open pit should have been started (against which massive streets protests were made in 2013) - 'Corna' and 'Cârnic' trail.
